decks.notes: The deck is built around utilizing Tasigur, the Golden Fang as a control commander in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The key concept of the deck lies in its extensive array of control spells and card advantage engines. With a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw spells, the deck aims to control the game by answering threats and disrupting opponents while generating card advantage to stay ahead. Tasigur's ability to recur cards from the graveyard adds another layer of resilience to the deck, allowing for continuous access to powerful spells. Additionally, the inclusion of versatile creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique provide additional control options and pressure on opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting your opponent's resources and board state while simultaneously setting up for big plays with Maelstrom Wanderer. The deck includes a variety of board wipes such as Destructive Force, Devastation, and All Is Dust to clear threats, along with counterspells like Cyclonic Rift and Chaos Warp to deal with problematic spells. The deck also features card advantage engines like Future Sight, Sylvan Library, and Mirri's Guile to ensure a steady stream of resources. With a mix of ramp, card draw, and disruption, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory in the long game.

This deck revolves around strong aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure opponents. Anafenza, the Foremost leads the charge, backed up by powerful removal like Vindicate and Toxic Deluge. The deck also includes key equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance the aggressive strategy. In addition, cards like Liliana of the Veil and Thoughtseize disrupt opponents' plans while providing card advantage. The mana base is optimized to support a wide range of spells and creatures, ensuring consistency in executing the aggressive game plan. Overall, this deck aims to quickly establish board control, disrupt opponents, and overpower them with efficient threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects. Tasigur, the Golden Fang serves as the commander, providing both card advantage and a threat on the battlefield. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells like Counterspell, Mana Leak, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, there are removal spells like Abrupt Decay, Dismember, and Toxic Deluge to deal with opposing threats. Card advantage is gained through cards like Dig Through Time, Thirst for Knowledge, and Snapcaster Mage. The mana base is diverse, allowing for easy access to multiple colors of mana to cast spells efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering and removing threats, while also utilizing card advantage and card selection to stay ahead of the opponent. Grand Arbiter Augustin IV helps to slow down the opponent's game plan by taxing their spells, giving you the time needed to set up your own win conditions. The deck includes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw engines to maintain control of the board and outvalue the opponent. It also includes a strong mana base to support the high number of blue spells and ensure consistency in casting spells. The overall strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, control the board, and eventually win through powerful finishers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion or Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The deck revolves around utilizing the Goblin tribal synergy to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By employing cards like Goblin Lackey and Goblin Recruiter, the deck aims to flood the board with efficient and powerful creatures, supported by lords like Goblin King and Goblin Chieftain to boost their abilities. Cards like Warren Instigator and Goblin Piledriver allow for explosive plays and quick damage output, while interaction and disruption through cards like Hymn to Tourach and Inquisition of Kozilek help control the opponent's game plan. The deck also features powerful combo potential with cards like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Siege-Gang Commander, as well as ways to generate extra value through cards like Dark Confidant and Purphoros, God of the Forge.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various spells and enchantments while ramping up mana to cast the powerful commander, Maelstrom Wanderer. The deck includes a variety of counter spells and board wipes to disrupt opponents' strategies, as well as cards like Scroll Rack and Sylvan Library for card advantage. The deck also includes a range of mana rocks and land ramp spells to accelerate mana production. The ultimate goal is to overwhelm opponents with a variety of threats, from Titans to Planeswalkers, while controlling the board and maintaining advantage. The deck is designed to be adaptable to different situations and opponents, making it a versatile and challenging deck to play against.

This control deck revolves around utilizing Narset's ability to cast spells for free off the top of the library. The deck focuses on a variety of counterspells, card draw, and removal spells to control the game and protect Narset. The land base is optimized for fixing mana and includes utility lands like Wasteland and Desolate Lighthouse. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Elspeth, Sun's Champion to generate value and control the board. Key spells like Time Warp and Temporal Trespass provide extra turns to further leverage Narset's ability. Overall, the deck aims to control the game, protect Narset, and win through incremental advantage and extra turn spells.
